title: The Missing Ledger
description: A critical government ledger tracking ration distribution has vanished from the Municipal Records Office. The Council demands answers — someone will be held accountable.
resistanceChoice: Elena took the ledger to expose ration fraud. You can convict her or lose it in paperwork.
stateChoice: Convict Elena as the Council expects. Quick, clean, rewarded.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: Tell me about this after-hours entry in the access log.

responseSequence: I don't know what you're talking about.
Lots of files go missing. It's a big office.
I already told you. I don't know anything about any ledger.
Fine.
I took it. But you don't understand — the numbers were wrong. They were starving Block D.

clickableClues.noteText: <person>Elena Vasquez</person> confessed to taking the <item>government ledger</item>
<person>Elena</person> claims the ledger revealed <location>Block D</location> was being deliberately under-rationed

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: Gregor signed out at 17:00. Where were you after that?

responseSequence: Home. I was home all night.
Where did you get that?
Fine... I was at the office. I went back after hours.

clickableClues.noteText: <person>Elena Vasquez</person> admitted to returning to the <location>Records Office</location> after hours on the night of the 14th

responseSequence: Stop asking me that!
I was HOME. I told you already!

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: Block D is getting half rations. What do you know about that?

responseSequence: How do you know about that?
The numbers were wrong. Someone in the Council office was skimming rations from Block D. I saw it in the ledger.

clickableClues.noteText: <person>Elena</person> confirms that someone in the <location>Council office</location> was diverting rations meant for <location>Block D</location>

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: You were at the Records Office after hours on the 14th. What were you doing there?

responseSequence: I already told you. I went back because something didn't sit right about the ration numbers.
I needed to check the ledger. I couldn't sleep knowing what I'd seen.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: You confessed to taking the ledger. Why should I believe anything else you say?

responseSequence: Because I'm telling the truth about why.
The rations were being stolen from Block D. I'm not a criminal — I did what I had to do.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: You say there's ration fraud. Can you prove it?

responseSequence: The proof was in the ledger! That's the whole point.
Why do you think I took it? Someone had to do something before more people starved.

lawyeredUpResponses: I'm not saying another word without legal representation.
You can't just interrogate me like this. I have rights.
rattledResponses: I... wait, what was the question? You're confusing me.
Please, just... I can't think when you keep pushing like this.
My hands won't stop shaking. Can we take a break?
shutdownResponses: I have nothing more to say.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: The access log shows someone entered after hours. Know anything about that?

responseSequence: I run a tight ship. Someone must have taken it after hours.
Check the access logs — I signed out at 17:00 sharp.

clickableClues.noteText: <person>Gregor Holtz</person> signed out at 17:00 sharp — his alibi checks out

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: You signed out at 17:00. Can anyone confirm that?

responseSequence: Of course. The security guard saw me leave. I went straight home.
I've worked there fifteen years. Never stayed past closing.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: Block D is getting half rations. Did you know about that?

responseSequence: I file what they give me. I don't set the numbers.
If something's off in the rations, that's above my pay grade.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: Elena was at the Records Office after hours. Did you know about that?

responseSequence: She was? I had no idea. The office should have been locked.
That's concerning. I always secure the building myself when I leave.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: Elena confessed to taking the ledger. What do you make of that?

responseSequence: Elena? She's one of my best clerks. I can't believe she'd do something like that.
This is going to come down on my head, isn't it? Missing ledger under my watch...

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: Elena says someone in the Council is stealing rations. Heard anything about that?

responseSequence: That's a dangerous accusation. If it's true, it goes way above my level.
I process paperwork. I don't question what comes from the Council. It's not worth the risk.

lawyeredUpResponses: I think it's best I speak with my union representative before continuing.
I've cooperated fully. If you want more, get my lawyer involved.
This conversation is over until I have counsel present.
rattledResponses: Look, I've been running that office for fifteen years and now THIS happens...
You're making me nervous. I didn't do anything wrong!
I need a moment. This is all too much.
shutdownResponses: I refuse to answer any more questions.

evidences.description: A torn note found in Elena's desk: 'The numbers don't add up. Block D is getting half rations. Someone has to do something.'
